life is good, DC the second weekend in June (Tori is the bestest for buying us plane tickets and ordering us to gome hangout!!)
the Brickskeller and its 1000 beers while we are there www.thebrickskeller.com/ can't wait to offend the uptight washington dc tight asses as this bar again. This place rules!!!

Ireland for 12 days June 30th! Which I know will be AMAZING!
yeah life is good
The new Icepick cd is fucking amazing! Ice-T ,Jamey Jasta, Lord Ezac.......... wow!

So we got back from DC on Monday after 3 days. What a cool fucking town. I could never live there, but it sure is fun as hell to visit. Tori was an amazing host, and has an amazing apartment. It is in this highrise that looks more like a fancy hotel than a place to live. But hey the government pays for her to be there so what the fuck. Friday night was kinda just a chill and have some drinks after 13 hours in the car. We got lost briefly getting to Albany to collect Krissy, then again for a few min. in DC (ghetto in DC when you are white is a bad place to be )
Sat. we got up, sat around for a little while drinking coffee, while me, Tori, and Krissy chain-smoked, swapping stories. Krissy is by far the coolest story teller ever. After that we went and saw all the touristy shit. The capitol, washington monument, lincoln memorial, vietnam wall ect. ect. Ate at a kickass mexican place. We met up with Beth's friends Derek, and Sara and headed to a bar called the brickskeller http://www.thebrickskeller.net/_wsn/page3.html (this is the beer list, over 1000 beers!) Yeah can you say shitfaced? We went back to Tori's. Beth passed out while me, Tori,Krissy and Derek talked about music and what not. Tori and Derek quickly faded, so it ended up with me and Krissy drinking and talking till 4am. Like I said she tells the best stories.
Sunday we went to brunch at a cool Irish pub and met Beth's cousin Mark and his scary wife. He was super cool, she made me want to claw my eyes out every time she opened her mouth.
We went to Arlington Cemetery, and spent a couple hours wandering around. If you want a truely moving experience go here. It is really something else. We visited JFK's grave, joe Lewis's grave, The tomb of the unknown soldier. It was real cool watching the guard in front of the tomb. He walks 21 paces at attention, stops, turns, clicks his heals, waits 21 seconds in salute, switches his rifle to the other shoulder and repeats these steps for an hour till he relieved by another guard. Tori said they were asked to stand down during one of the hurricanes for their safety and they refused. When they take the honor of this detail they have to agree never to swear, drink, or smoke for the rest of their lives. Pretty fucked up.
After we left Derek and Kriss went to get his car which apperently had been moved due to filing for the west wing. It took them the better part of 3 hours to track it down. I would have been bullshit if someone had moved my car 15 blocks away. The worst was that the people who moved it totally didn't keep track of it so they had no clue where it was. If one of the cops had not been a navy guy (Derek is in the navy and had to be back on base by 5am the next morning or he was in some serious shit) they would have gotten no help finding his car.
So they found it, we ate, laughed till we hurt, and went to bed. The next morning we climbed back in the car and headed back. This time it only took 11 hours to deposit Krissy in Albany and make it back home.
Fucking great weekend. I will post pictures as soon as I can get them off my phone. I love how you buy a brand new razr and you have to spend another 70 bucks on the usb cable and software to upload the pictures you take on it.
motherfuckers

...... I had a little accident while I was dry-heaving"
HAHAHAHAAHA funniest thing ever, and the wrong thing to come up and tell a van with 5 guys who have the mentality of 12 year olds.
Canada once again was fucking amazing
+ great shows
+ Seb from Five Seven traveling with us and being our translator all weekend
+ getting paid alot of money for the shows
+ selling all of our merch
+ getting through the border in 2 minutes
+ "SHIT YOUR.... FUCKING PANTS!"
+ having 200 kids (and 3/4 of them HOT girls) at the show in Jonquiere
+ driving through the 2 1/2 hour national park which was fucking amazing
+ tit bars and getting absolutely shitfaced in Montreal
+ great friends and great times
+ Matt shitting his pants and having hours and hours of entertainment from it
+ Spit Ya Teeth coming up with us and getting a great response at the shows
+ "FAT BITCHES CREW"
+ AMAZING FOOD (.99 pizza slices, poutine, st. hubert)
+ the motel giving us the wrong room key and busting in on some couple in bed
+ meeting lots of amazing people (George, Maude, James, xla familiax, Stand As One)
+ Dave destroying the running board on the van trying to get out of the parking garage
+ the guys in Pressure letting us crash at their house www.ifuckinglovepressure.com
+ George paying for our hotel room on top of all the money he already had paid us
+ george telling us "Fuck you guys, your letting me pay for your fucking room."

- beer all freezing in Jonquiere
- 6 feet of snow in Jonquiere
- 15 fucking below in Jonquiere
- having to leave Canada
- everyone being sick now
- Dave's poutine ass
- not getting to see Essa in QC (I missed you :( )

Great fucking weekend
Good friends, and good fucking times

6 hours, 2 sittings and my leg  is almost done. Thank you Jasin.

there is actually alot more detail on the front of my shin then the photo picked up
2 more sittings and and my leg will be sleeved. We have 1 more section to fill and shade and then he is going to go over the skulls again, fill around my ankle and below my knee and we are done.

I have a appointment next sunday to start filling in the rest of my lower left arm. I will post pics when it is done.

Get psyched!!! Not much going on lately. Working a shitload the past couple weeks. I have 2 new jobs so no more mall hell YAY!!!!! Things are amazing with Beth and just keep getting better and better. I realize that I have the most amazing g/f in the world. I got to work Warped Tour this year again. It was fun but not many bands I was really into this time around. I did get to work the stage that Bane was playing on which was amazing. They sounded better than I have ever heard them play. I got introduced to a new band that was amazing as well, Chuck Brunswick. Check em out at www.myspace.com/chuckbrunswick We are playing Sept. 11 with Stretch Armstrong @ the Kave in fucksport which should be fun as shit. We are also going into the studio in the next month or so with legendary producer/engineer Don Fury in Brooklyn NY. I am so fucking psyched for this it is not even funny. Thats it for now. Back to work I go. PEACE!

...... and I could care less about the lower east side!"

So its been awhile, but since it was an eventful weekend I figured what the fuck. Here we go....

Sat. night me and Beth met up with this lovely young lady from NY. Her name is Tory and she rocks.

 

Tory and Beth

We had lots of drinks and got absolutely wasted.

Sun. I had the kiddos then we had a show at the station with The Bars who were AMAZING, the Kill Takers who were amazing as well. Shitty turnout but fun show. Watching Darren hit on Tory was the best part of the night. Darren is a skate punk that thinks he is Bam. Irritating YES, annoying Yes, but harmless and fucking hilarious. He physically kissed my girlfriend's ass at one point trying to get her to buy him a beer. Funny shit.

Darren              Darren and Tory

2nd night of  lots of drinks and absolutely shitfaced

wasted Beth and I

Mon. I fucked around downtown for awhile then we headed to Lewiston to play at Legends. Cool club, shitty bands (they were mostly death metal bands) shitty crowd. We all left not too long after we played.

Tue. we played in Auburn at the legion hall and it was amazing. A fucking great show, semi-decent turnout, lots of good mosh, lots of people singing along with our shit, just a fucking fun set. All the bands sounded great, alot of old and new friends. Just an all around great show and by far the best show of the 3 day stretch.

We hopefully head out on tour down the eastcoast for a week the end of July with our bro's On The Outside so that should be fun.

ps........................

June 18th SLAPSHOT!!!!!!!! that will be an amzing show I am sure.

This sat. we are playing with Murphys Law, you all know that you want to go to this. I have a feeling the mosh at this will be absolutely amazing, SO GO! we will have lots of merch as well (demos -newly recorded at big sound-, shirts, hoodies, stickers probably more) we will also have tix for the 100 Demon show next sunday(april 17th) at the Kave, they will be 8 bucks from Kathy, we will be seeling them for only 6 bucks so def. grab a ticket for next sunday as well. .............. bust it

"To put it all behind me, would be like stopping time. But what else can I do when time is all I have? Have you ever thought, about the time thats gone? Leave before the sunrise, come back when the world is sleeping. Every now and then, I run out of time."

wow it is really shitty outside right now. I am glad Sara is the sweetheart that she is and picked my ass up to hangout so that I did not have to take the bus home. I have really had enough of winter, I just want it to be warm and nice again.
We all went snowboarding yesterday and I hurt like hell today. I am pretty sure I broke my ass, but I can't wait to go again. After the initial horror of coming off the chairlift and looking down this huge fucking moutain that I was supposed sail down on a snowboard, it was fun. I need to work on my turning and stopping skills next time since I had a hard time with both of those.
4 more days of vacation left, it is going by way too fast.
Till Death will be recording soon. I will post when we have the date so people can come and do back up vocals if they want.
keep you all posted.

wow 2 updates in 1 day.
I went snowboarding for the first time ever today. It was fun after the first run. I fell SOOOOOOO many times and am sure I will be super hating life tomorrow morning. I have tons of road rash on my back from bailing so many times and I am pretty sure I sprained my wrist but fuck it I had a blast. Luckily Janna is good and very patient, since I def. made her, Sara, and Jockins wait while I fell down the mountain.
fun fun fun

So I got new ink yesterday on the back of my neck. Paul Leclair from Bombshell did this and it is tasty.

I am psyched. YAY!!!

Sara told me when she arrived to collect me tonight that it is a whopping 8 degrees out. I HATE WINTER!!!!
We went shopping today, I actually got MOST of my x-mas shopping done. Which is much diferent from most years when I am at walmart x-mas eve trying to get ALL my shopping done. I got the kids the ninja turtle sewer lair playset, they will be super excited.
In other news I am getting a car sometime this week. It is a '93 Ford Festiva. Not the most pimp ride but it will get me where I need to go and more importantly it is FREE. I am really stoked about this, hopefully I can get it on the road in a couple weeks when I can pay for insurance and registration and all that happy horseshit.
Now Sara is singing about her ghetto tree, so it is time to go watch TV.
End of important update

also you all should go check out www.homestarrunner.com  check out the strongbad emails

I will live and die as all humanity has. I will live with unrealized potential. I will die in vain. I will live with unjustified privilege. I will die unfulfilled. I will live and die and love and cry quietly and unnoticed. I will have bled, upset my pathetic life in constant confusion. I will have searched, realized that the truth never existed while it lay undiscovered before me. I will have learned, dumbed by a false truth that all is irrelevent. I will have cowered, incapacitated by an instilled fear. I will have hate, known the fury and motivation of it. I will have despaired, daily destroyed by my own futility. I will have bled, drank vital from humanity because of my birth. I will have consumed, killed for my own waste and greed. I will have loved, revered the joy and the pain of it. I will have produced, felt the slavery and the empowerment of it. I will have cared, consumed on occasion by compassion and guilt. I will have marvelled, awed by nature and its life.
I love life (I love YOU)
It will all be, be done soon now. One more sublime waste in all its grandeur. A nothing requiem will lay testament to a nothing life. I, one more unknown will rise and fall in anonymity.

GO DIE!
I quit........... its been a great night and all but I am done.

Last night was fun. There was a benefit for Todd to benefit his widow, son and the house he was building for them when he died a month ago. It started at Amigos and then continued at Bubba Sulky Lounge (one of the sketchiest bars in town I have ever been in) I met Missy and Megs @ Amigos and only caught Tony Mcnobie's set. I had never seen his newer band, and they were real good. It surprised me that it was nothing like Rustic Overtones. Much more R+B type music. I was impressed. So we headed to Bubba's after that. Hellwheel drive was playing when we got there. BOOOOOOO that band is the most monotonous band I have ever heard in my life. Long songs, and they all drone on and sound the same. Someone else played after them that I didn't really pay attention to, I was to busy getting drunk to notice. Twisted Roots came on after that. I realize everytime I see these guys how much I have always really enjoyed them. They played alot of older songs which was awesome. They also played "stronger then the flesh" in Todd's memory which is reall cool because they never play that anymore and it is such a good song. I had them playing songs I wanted at the end of their the set which rules. All in all Toddapalooza was a good time.
the end

I feel so helpless lately. My friends come to me for advice or to talk, and all I try to do is help but most of the time end up feeling like I have done nothing but make matters worst. I have so much on my mind lately, so many of my own problems that I can't do anything about. It's just so hard to try and help the people you I care about, and then try and work my own shit out. While feeling like all I have done is upset the person more by trying to be honest. It suck to hear someone you care about crying because of something you said even though it was something that someone else did. Which makes me think would it have been better to have just not said anything at all?
All I can do is try.............
I am hoping very much that thursday works out.

We both lie silently still in the dead of the night Although we both lie close together We feel miles apart inside Was it somethin' I said or somethin' I did Did my words not come out right Tho' I tried not to hurt you Tho' I tried But I guess that's why they say Every rose has its thorn Just like every night has it's dawn Just like every cowboy sings a sad, sad song Every rose has its thorn Yea it does I listen to your favorite song playin' on the radio the DJ says love's a game of Easy come and easy go But I wonder does he know Has he ever felt like this And I know that you'd be here right now If I could have let you know somehow I guess Every rose has its thorn Just like every night has it's dawn Just like every cowboy sings a sad, sad song Every rose has its thorn Though it's been a while now I can still feel so much pain Like a knife that cuts you The wound heals, but the scar, that scar remains I know I could have saved our love that night If I'd known what to say Instead of making love We both made our separate ways Now I hear you've found somebody new And that I never meant that much to you To hear that tears me up inside And to see you cuts me like a knife

that was what I woke up to today. It took me a minute to figure out who Shawn was talking about, but lets face it.... no conversation that starts out like that is bound to be good. Todd died yesterday morning from an asthma attack. WTF!!?? ASTHMA ATTACK????
Todd was one of the nicest, most down to earth guys I have ever met in my life. He was one of those people that would go out of his way to help anyone. Didn't matter who, or what is was he was there to help. He was the first to try and make you laugh if he thought you were down. Just an all around great guy. I keep thinking back to Halloween a couple of years ago. He showed up at Amigos in this all white skintight outfit (Todd is black), with a tight white small baseball cap on. carrying a small lantern. Nobody could figure out WHAT he was supposed to be. After hours of people guessing he finally just posed with the lantern held out in front of him and said "I am a lawn jockey". It was perfect because when he posed that way that was exactly what he looked like. We were all laughing so hard EVERYONE in the bar was crying, Todd included.
He was a great guy, a good husband, a great friend to many, and a great father. He will dearly be missed by all of us.

DIE

Falling down on this new day.
Watching time pass by.
As blackened shadows fall
beneath your eyes.
Nothing ever changes.
Things just stay the same.
Closing your eyes you wish for a whole new day
There's a movement
and it comes from within.
To make a real man stand up strong.
On the rebound from reality.
He has no friends to break his fall.
Conviction of a new day.
Brings a new found truth.
The truth he's never lived before.
Mentality of a madman. He spins a web.
And he'll always be caught in time.
Days go by.
And you wonder who to be.
To be the same old kid.
Or to turn another page.
Reckless wonderment.
As you drop down to your knees.
Think about your life and how it's been thrown away.

0-24 - poser! get out or be forced out.
25-44 - beginner. attend more shows, buy more records, you'll be fine. 
45-74 - scenester. you've been around awhile and you know what's up, good job.
75 - or more - GOD! i bow to thee with your knowledge of everything hardcore.

So yesterday I had a long shatty day at work. Probably had the worst migrain I have had in years, just not a good day. Got home, still not feeling too hot, and the phone rings. It was Jeran, and she had driven up to surprise me, but we managed to miss each other at the mall. Words cannot even begin to describe how happy I was. She took me out to dinner @ Olive Garden. Then we came back and hung out here for a bit. What started out as a pretty piss poor day ended up being awesome.
Today was pretty long, I had to work late, and didn't end up getting to talk to my fav. person. I am tired.
